channel.title: Tham Le's Notes
channel.description: Last 10 notes on Tham Le's Notes

item.title: Roadmaps Overview
item.description: 00-Roadmaps Learning paths and progress tracking for systems development.

item.title: The-Complete-Systems-Developer-Roadmap
item.description: Phase 1: The Foundations - “How a Computer Actually Works” Goal: Build a solid mental model of the machine. No complex code yet. Pure concepts.

item.title: Systems Overview
item.description: 03-Systems Operating systems and systems programming concepts. Contents Process vs. Thread vs.

item.title: Transport Layer
item.description: WTF is the Transport Layer? It’s the difference between “I don’t care if you got my message” and “I need to know you got every single byte” The Delivery Service Analogy You need to send something to a friend.

item.title: Transport-Protocols
item.description: WTF are Transport Protocols? It’s the menu of options for getting your data from point A to point B, with different tradeoffs The Shipping Company Analogy You need to send a package across the country.

item.title: Network-Layer
item.description: Network-Layer It’s the post office of the internet The Postal Service Analogy You write a letter to your friend across the country.

item.title: Networking Overview
item.description: 05-Networking Network protocols, communication patterns, and internet fundamentals.

item.title: Ethernet
item.description: Ethernet It’s the reason your computer can talk to your router without screaming into the void The Office Memo Analogy Imagine an office where everyone sits in cubicles.
